meanings.definition: The side of a vehicle closest to the curb when parked.
meanings.sent1: When parking, make sure to leave enough space on the nearside.
meanings.sent2: The car's nearside mirror was damaged in the accident.
meanings.sent3: The nearside of the truck seemed to have a magnetic pull towards the curb.
meanings.sent4: As the bus turned, the nearside scraped against the low wall.
meanings.sent5: The nearside of the van had a sticker that read 'Caution: Wide Turn'.

meanings.definition: The left side of a horse when mounted.
meanings.sent1: She adjusted the saddle on the nearside of the horse.
meanings.sent2: The rider gracefully mounted the horse from the nearside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat decided to climb up the nearside of the horse.
meanings.sent4: The nearside of the horse bore the imprint of the rider's boot.
meanings.sent5: The nearside of the horse was where the rider felt most secure.

meanings.definition: Close to or adjacent to something.
meanings.sent1: The nearside table held a stack of books.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to sit on the nearside of the room during meetings.
meanings.sent3: The nearside chair was always the comfiest in the living room.
meanings.sent4: The nearside window offered a view of the garden.
meanings.sent5: The nearside corner of the park was a peaceful spot for picnics.
